addTranche(address,uint16).details: The order of the tranches is important, the most senior tranche is added first at index 0, the most junior at the last index.Each Tranche is an ERC4626 contract.The interest weight of each Tranche determines the relative share of the yield (interest payments) that goes to its Liquidity providers.

params.interestWeight_: The interest weight of the specific Tranche.

params.account: The address of the Arcadia Account backing the debt.
params.amount: The amount of underlying ERC20 tokens to be lent out.
params.beneficiary: The address of the beneficiary who can take out debt backed by an Arcadia Account.

auctionRepay(uint256,uint256,uint256,add.details: This function allows a liquidator to repay a specified amount of debt for a user.

params.account: The contract address of the Arcadia Account backing the debt.
params.amount: The amount repaid by a bidder during the auction.
params.minimumMargin_: The minimum margin of the Account.
params.startDebt: The amount of debt of the Account the moment the liquidation was initiated.

returns.earlyTerminate: Bool indicating whether the full amount of debt was repaid.

borrow(uint256,address,address,bytes3).details: The sender might be different than the owner if they have the proper allowances.

params.account: The address of the Arcadia Account backing the debt.
params.amount: The amount of underlying ERC20 tokens to be lent out.
params.referrer: A unique identifier of the referrer, who will receive part of the fees generated by this transaction.
params.to: The address who receives the lent out underlying tokens.

calcUnrealisedDebt().details: To calculate the unrealised debt over an amount of time, you need to calculate D[(1+r)^x-1]. The base of the exponential: 1 + r, is a 18 decimals fixed point number with r the yearly interest rate. The exponent of the exponential: x, is a 18 decimals fixed point number. The exponent x is calculated as: the amount of seconds passed since last sync timestamp divided by the average of seconds per year.

params.guardian_: The address of the new guardian.

closeMarginAccount(address).details: This function checks if the given Account address has an open position. If not, it can be closed.

constructor.details: The name and symbol of the DebtToken are automatically generated, based on the name and symbol of the underlying token.

params.accountFactory: The contract address of the Arcadia Account Factory.
params.asset_: The underlying ERC20 token of the Lending Pool.
params.liquidator: The contract address of the Liquidator.
params.riskManager_: The address of the new Risk Manager.
params.treasury_: The address of the protocol treasury.

convertToAssets(uint256).details: Since debt is a liability instead of an asset, roundUp and roundDown are inverted compared to the standard implementation.

convertToShares(uint256).details: Since debt is a liability instead of an asset, roundUp and roundDown are inverted compared to the standard implementation.

depositInLendingPool(uint256,address).details: This function can only be called by Tranches.

params.assets: The amount of assets of the underlying ERC20 tokens being deposited.
params.from: The address of the Liquidity Provider who deposits the underlying ERC20 token via a Tranche.

donateToTranche(uint256,uint256).details: Can be used by anyone to donate assets to the Lending Pool. It is supposed to serve as a way to compensate the jrTranche after an auction didn't get sold and was manually liquidated after cutoffTime.Inflation attacks by the first depositor in the Tranches have to be prevented with virtual assets/shares.

params.assets: The amount of assets of the underlying ERC20 tokens being deposited.
params.trancheIndex: The index of the tranche to donate to.

flashAction(uint256,address,address,byte.details: The sender might be different than the owner if they have the proper allowances.accountManagementAction() works similar to flash loans, this function optimistically calls external logic and checks for the Account state at the very end.

params.account: The address of the Arcadia Account backing the debt.
params.actionData: A bytes object containing three actionAssetData structs, an address array and a bytes array.
params.actionTarget: The address of the Action Target to call.
params.amountBorrowed: The amount of underlying ERC20 tokens to be lent out.
params.referrer: A unique identifier of the referrer, who will receive part of the fees generated by this transaction.

flashActionCallback(bytes).details: During the callback, the Account cannot be reentered and the actionTimestamp is updated.

params.callbackData: The data for the actions that have to be executed by the Creditor during a flashAction.

returns._0: baseRatePerYear The base interest rate per year.
returns._1: lowSlopePerYear The slope of the interest rate per year when the utilization rate is below the utilization threshold.
returns._2: highSlopePerYear The slope of the interest rate per year when the utilization rate exceeds the utilization threshold.
returns._3: utilisationThreshold The utilization threshold for determining the interest rate slope change.

returns._0: initiationWeight Reward paid to the Liquidation Initiator.
returns._1: penaltyWeight Penalty paid by the Account owner to the Creditor.
returns._2: terminationWeight Reward paid to the Liquidation closer.
returns._3: minRewardWeight The minimum reward that is paid to the initiator/terminator of a liquidation.
returns._4: maxReward The maximum reward that is paid to the initiator/terminator of a liquidation.

getOpenPosition(address).details: The open position is the sum of all liabilities.

returns.openPosition: The open position of the Account.

liquidityOf(address).details: liquidityOf() might deviate from the actual liquidityOf after interests are synced in the following situations:   - liquidityOf() the treasury will be slightly underestimated, since all rounding errors of all tranches will go to the treasury.   - Tranches with 0 liquidity don't earn any interests, interests will go to treasury instead.   - If totalInterestWeight is 0 (will never happen) all interests will go to treasury instead.

params.owner_: The address of the liquidity provider.

returns.assets: The redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset.

liquidityOfAndSync(address).details: This function syncs the interests to prevent calculating UnrealisedDebt twice when depositing/withdrawing through the Tranches.After calling this function, the interest rate will not be updated until the next processInterests() call.

params.owner_: The address of the liquidity provider.

returns.assets: The redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset.

openMarginAccount(uint256).details: This function response is used for the Arcadia Accounts margin account creation. This function does not deploy a new Arcadia Account. It just provides the parameters to be used in Arcadia Account to connect to the Creditor.

params.accountVersion: The version of the Arcadia Account.

returns.minimumMargin_: The minimum amount of collateral that must be held in the Account before a position can be opened, denominated in the numeraire.
returns.success: Bool indicating if all requirements are met.

pause().details: This function will pause the functionality to: - Repay debt. - Withdraw liquidity. - Borrow. - Deposit liquidity. - Liquidate positions.

previewMint(uint256).details: Since debt is a liability instead of an asset, roundUp and roundDown are inverted compared to the standard implementation.

previewWithdraw(uint256).details: Since debt is a liability instead of an asset, roundUp and roundDown are inverted compared to the standard implementation.

repay(uint256,address).details: if Account is not an actual address of an Arcadia Account, maxWithdraw(account) will always return 0. Function will not revert, but amount is always 0.Anyone (EOAs and contracts) can repay debt in the name of an Account.

params.account: The contract address of the Arcadia Account backing the debt.
params.amount: The amount of underlying ERC20 tokens to be repaid.

params.accountVersion: the Account version to be enabled/disabled.
params.valid: The validity of the respective accountVersion.

setInterestParameters(uint72,uint72,uint.details: We cannot use a struct to store all variables, since this would cause the contract size to exceed the maximum size.

params.baseRatePerYear_: The base interest rate per year.
params.highSlopePerYear_: The slope of the interest rate per year when the utilization rate exceeds the utilization threshold.
params.lowSlopePerYear_: The slope of the interest rate per year when the utilization rate is below the utilization threshold.
params.utilisationThreshold_: The utilization threshold for determining the interest rate slope change.

setInterestWeightTranche(uint256,uint16).details: The interest weight of each Tranche determines the relative share of yield (interest payments) that goes to its Liquidity providers.

params.index: The index of the Tranche for which a new interest weight is being set.
params.interestWeight_: The new interest weight of the Tranche at the index.

setLiquidationParameters(uint16,uint16,u.details: Each weight has 4 decimals precision (50 equals 0,005 or 0,5%).Each weight sets the % of the debt that is paid as reward to the initiator and terminator of a liquidation. This reward is capped in absolute value by the maxReward respectively maxReward.We cannot use a struct to store all variables, since this would cause the contract size to exceed the maximum size.

params.initiationWeight_: Reward paid to the Liquidation Initiator.
params.maxReward_: The maximum reward that is paid to the initiator/terminator of a liquidation.
params.minRewardWeight_: The minimum reward that is paid to the initiator/terminator of a liquidation.
params.penaltyWeight_: Penalty paid by the Account owner to the Creditor.
params.terminationWeight_: Reward paid to the Liquidation closer.

setLiquidationWeightTranche(uint16).details: The liquidation weight determines the relative share of liquidation fees that goes to the most Junior Tranche.

params.liquidationWeight: The new liquidation weight of the Tranche at the highest index.

setMinimumMargin(uint96).details: The minimum margin should be a conservative upper estimate of the maximal gas cost to liquidate a position (fixed cost, independent of openDebt). The minimumMargin prevents dusting attacks, and ensures that upon liquidations positions are big enough to cover network transaction costs while remaining attractive to liquidate.

setOriginationFee(uint8).details: originationFee is limited by being a uint8 -> max value is 2.55% 4 decimal precision (10 = 0.1%).

params.riskManager_: The address of the new Risk Manager.

params.treasury_: The new address of the treasury.

setTreasuryWeights(uint16,uint16).details: The interestWeight determines the relative share of the yield (interest payments) that goes to the protocol treasury.Setting interestWeightTreasury to a very high value will cause the treasury to collect all interest fees from that moment on. Although this will affect the future profits of liquidity providers, no funds nor realized interest are at risk for LPs.

params.interestWeight_: The new interestWeight of the treasury.
params.liquidationWeight: The new liquidationWeight of the treasury.

settleLiquidationHappyFlow(address,uint2.details: In the happy flow, the auction proceeds are sufficient to pay off enough debt  to bring the Account in a healthy position, and pay out all liquidation incentives to the  relevant actors.

params.account: The address of the Account undergoing liquidation settlement.
params.minimumMargin_: The minimum margin of the Account.
params.startDebt: The initial debt amount of the liquidated Account.
params.terminator: The address of the liquidation terminator.

settleLiquidationUnhappyFlow(address,uin.details: In the unhappy flow, the auction proceeds are not sufficient to pay out all liquidation incentives  and maybe not even to pay off all debt.The order in which incentives are not paid out/ bad debt is settled is fixed:   - First, the "liquidationFee", going towards LPs and the Treasury is not paid out.   - Next, the "terminationReward", going towards the terminator of the auction is not paid out.   - Next, the underlying assets of LPs in the most junior Tranche are written off pro rata.   - Next, the underlying assets of LPs in the second most junior Tranche are written off pro rata.   - etc.

params.account: The address of the Account undergoing liquidation settlement.
params.minimumMargin_: The minimum margin of the Account.
params.startDebt: The initial debt amount of the liquidated Account.
params.terminator: The address of the auction terminator.

skim().details: In normal conditions (when there are no ongoing auctions), the total Claimable Liquidity should be equal to the sum of the available funds (the balanceOf() the underlying asset) in the pool and the total open debt. In practice the actual sum of available funds and total open debt will always be bigger than the total Claimable Liquidity. This because of the rounding errors of the ERC4626 calculations (conversions between assets and shares), or because someone accidentally sent funds directly to the pool instead of depositing via a Tranche. This functions makes the surplus available to the Treasury (otherwise they would be lost forever).In case you accidentally sent funds to the pool, contact the current treasury manager.

startLiquidation(address,uint256).details: This function is only callable by an Arcadia Account with debt. The liquidation process involves assessing the Account's debt and calculating liquidation incentives, which are considered as extra debt. The extra debt is then minted towards the Account to encourage the liquidation process and bring the Account to a healthy state.Only Accounts with non-zero balances can have debt, and debtTokens are non-transferrable.If the provided Account has a debt balance of 0, the function reverts with the error "IsNotAnAccountWithDebt."

params.initiator: The address of the liquidation initiator.
params.minimumMargin_: The minimum margin of the Account.

returns.startDebt: The initial debt of the liquidated Account.

returns.totalDebt: The total debt in underlying assets.

returns.totalLiquidity_: The total redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: No public transferFrom allowed.The functions approve() and permit() will not revert, but since transferFrom() reverts, it can never be used to transfer tokens.

unpause().details: This function will unpause the functionality to: - Repay debt. - Withdraw liquidity. - Liquidate positions.

unpause(bool,bool,bool,bool,bool).details: This function can unPause repay, withdraw, borrow, and deposit individually.Can only update flags from paused (true) to unPaused (false), cannot be used the other way around (to set unPaused flags to paused).

params.borrowPaused_: False when borrow functionality should be unPaused.
params.depositPaused_: False when deposit functionality should be unPaused.
params.liquidationPaused_: False when liquidation functionality should be unPaused.
params.repayPaused_: False when repay functionality should be unPaused.
params.withdrawPaused_: False when withdraw functionality should be unPaused.

updateInterestRate().details: Any address can call this, it will sync unrealised interests and update the interest rate.

withdrawFromLendingPool(uint256,address).details: This function can be called by anyone with an open balance (realisedLiquidityOf[address] bigger than 0), which can be both Tranches as other address (treasury, Liquidation Initiators, Liquidated Account Owner...).

params.assets: The amount of assets of the underlying ERC20 tokens being withdrawn.
params.receiver: The address of the receiver of the underlying ERC20 tokens.

addTranche(address,uint16).notice: Adds a tranche to the Lending Pool.

approveBeneficiary(address,uint256,addre.notice: Approve a beneficiary to take out debt against an Arcadia Account.

borrow(uint256,address,address,bytes3).notice: Takes out debt backed by collateral in an Arcadia Account.

changeGuardian(address).notice: This function is used to set the guardian address

closeMarginAccount(address).notice: Checks if Account can be closed.

constructor.notice: The constructor for a lending pool.

convertToAssets(uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 convertToShares implementation.

convertToShares(uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 convertToShares implementation.

deposit(uint256,address).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 deposit implementation.

depositInLendingPool(uint256,address).notice: Deposit assets in the Lending Pool.

donateToTranche(uint256,uint256).notice: Donate assets to the Lending Pool.

flashAction(uint256,address,address,byte.notice: Execute and interact with external logic on leverage.

flashActionCallback(bytes).notice: Callback of the Account during a flashAction.

getInterestRateConfig().notice: Returns the configuration of the interest rate slopes.

getOpenPosition(address).notice: Returns the open position of the Account.

liquidityOf(address).notice: Returns the redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset of an address.

liquidityOfAndSync(address).notice: Returns the redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset of an address.

mint(uint256,address).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 deposit implementation.

openMarginAccount(uint256).notice: Checks if Account fulfills all requirements and returns Creditor parameters.

pause().notice: This function is used to pause all the flags of the contract.

previewMint(uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 previewMint implementation.

previewWithdraw(uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 previewWithdraw implementation.

redeem(uint256,address,address).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 redeem implementation.

riskManager().notice: Returns the Risk Manager of the creditor.

setAccountVersion(uint256,bool).notice: Enables or disables a certain Account version to be used as margin account.

setInterestWeightTranche(uint256,uint16).notice: Changes the interest weight of a specific Tranche.

setLiquidationWeightTranche(uint16).notice: Changes the liquidation weight of the most Junior Tranche.

setMinimumMargin(uint96).notice: Sets the minimum amount of collateral that must be held in an Account before a position can be opened.

setTreasuryWeights(uint16,uint16).notice: Changes the interest and liquidation weight of the Treasury.

settleLiquidationHappyFlow(address,uint2.notice: Ends the liquidation process for a specific Account and settles the liquidation incentives.

settleLiquidationUnhappyFlow(address,uin.notice: Ends the liquidation process for a specific Account and settles the liquidation incentives/bad debt.

skim().notice: Skims any surplus funds in the LendingPool to the treasury.

startLiquidation(address,uint256).notice: Initiates the liquidation process for an Account.

totalAssets().notice: Returns the total amount of outstanding debt in the underlying asset.

totalLiquidity().notice: Returns the total redeemable amount of liquidity in the underlying asset.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 transfer implementation.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 transferFrom implementation.

unpause().notice: This function is used to unpause flags that could be abused to lock user assets.

unpause(bool,bool,bool,bool,bool).notice: This function is used to unpause one or more flags.

withdraw(uint256,address,address).notice: Modification of the standard ERC4626 withdraw implementation.

withdrawFromLendingPool(uint256,address).notice: Withdraw assets from the Lending Pool.
